question: Which keyword is used to declare a class in C#?
What is the correct way to declare a constant in C#?
Which of the following is used to perform input and output operations in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'using' statement in C#?
Which operator is used for string concatenation in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'static' keyword in C#?
options1: To specify that a variable cannot be modified
options2: To specify that a variable is shared among all instances of the class
options3: To specify that a variable can hold any type of data
options4: To specify that a variable exists throughout the program's execution
answer: To specify that a variable is shared among all instances of the class

question: Which keyword is used to define a method in C#?
What is the purpose of the 'this' keyword in C#?
options1: To refer to the current class instance
options2: To refer to the superclass instance
options3: To refer to the subclass instance
options4: To refer to the current method
answer: To refer to the current class instance

question: What is the purpose of the 'public' access modifier in C#?
options1: To restrict access to members of a class
options2: To allow access from any assembly
options3: To restrict access to derived classes
answer: To allow access from any assembly

question: What is the purpose of the 'new' keyword in C#?
options1: To create an instance of a class
options4: To refer to the current class instance
answer: To create an instance of a class

question: What is the purpose of the 'virtual' keyword in C#?
options2: To define a pure virtual function
